channel.title: Deleting Walls
channel.description: How do you delete walls i know how to do it with objects but there is something messed up wit dem wallz

item.title: Deleting Walls
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:8, topic:148759”]To use this declare this method, public void deleteThatObject2(int objectX, int objectY, int type) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, type); } For that extra var put the object type.[/quote]

dont forget to mention -1 is the way its facing, it goes from -1 to 2

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting Walls
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

you can deleat anything throguh the cache, even the sprites(icons), you can delete 97% of the map useing the server with stuff called “bounderies”, these couse black to apear on the minimap and the played map for certen areas. the Deleteobject(coord x, coord y) is what you need, though, it may be different in your source, mine has eraseojbect in 1 of them, another has delobject in 1, and my newest has killobject(i made killobject :)) you just need to fidn the correct thing

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting Walls
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You can’t delete walls/buldings using those methods as simply as people say. Things in the cache, I’m pretty sure, cannot be deleted server-side, but possibly client-side(?).

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting Walls
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

[code]public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);
}

public void Deleteobjects() {
deletethatobject(3238, 3434); //delete varrock fountain
deletethatobject(3238, 3435); //delete bench
deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Table
deletethatobject(3255, 3434); //delete Table
deletethatobject(3255, 3431); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3257, 3433); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3251, 3431); //delete Stool
}
[/code]

If that helps any

Read full topic

item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

Well im stumped there
I already said what I thought might work

but find this

public void deleteObject(int objectX, int objectY)

and maybe try doing
deletethatobject(x-coord,y-coord)
